coref: A long time ago Man met a Satyr in the forest and succeeded in making friends with Man. The two soon became the best of comrades, living together in Man's hut. But one cold winter evening, as they were walking homeward, a Satyr saw the Man blow on a Satyr fingers. Why do you do that? asked a Satyr. To warm my hands, Man replied. When they reached home Man prepared two bowls of porridge. These Man placed steaming hot on the table, and the comrades sat down very cheerfully to enjoy the meal. But much to a Satyr's surprise, Man began to blow into Man bowl of porridge. Why do you do that? Man asked. To cool my porridge, replied Man. a Satyr a Satyr sprang hurriedly to a Satyr feet and made for the door. Goodby, a Satyr said, I've seen enough. A fellow that blows hot and cold in the same breath cannot be friends with a Satyr!
